meanings.definition: Using few words; expressing much in few words
meanings.sent1: She appreciated his laconic response to her question.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's laconic explanation made the concept easy to understand.
meanings.sent3: The parrot's laconic mimicry of human speech always amused the visitors.
meanings.sent4: His laconic style of painting captured the essence of the scene with just a few brushstrokes.
meanings.sent5: The detective's laconic manner revealed more than his words ever could.

meanings.sent3: The comedian's laconic jokes had the crowd roaring with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The clock's ticking was a laconic reminder of the passing time.
meanings.sent5: The old man's laconic wisdom was sought after by all in the village.
